meanings.sent1: After the storm, the town was resupplied with food and water.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were resupplied with ammunition before heading into battle.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful hiker had to be resupplied with snacks multiple times during the hike.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness resupplied my faith in humanity.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic quickly resupplied the toolbox with new tools.

meanings.definition: To provide with a fresh supply
meanings.sent1: The store resupplied its shelves with fresh fruits and vegetables every morning.
meanings.sent2: The airline resupplied the plane with fuel before the long flight.
meanings.sent3: The chef resupplied the buffet with delicious dishes as soon as they ran out.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter resupplied the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The gardener resupplied the flower bed with colorful blooms.

meanings.sent1: The office resupplied the stationery cabinet with pens and paper.
meanings.sent2: The camping store resupplied the hikers with extra gear for the trip.
meanings.sent3: The teacher resupplied the classroom with more textbooks for the students.
meanings.sent4: His determination resupplied his motivation to finish the project.
meanings.sent5: The chef resupplied the kitchen with fresh ingredients for the next dish.
